bug.author: fansgit
bug.description: The link to <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/examples/tutorials/monitors/iris_monitors.py>iris_monitor.py</denchmark-link> returns on Tensorflow tutorial <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.10/tutorials/monitors/index.html#logging-and-monitoring-basics-with-tf-contrib-learn>logging-and-monitoring-basics</denchmark-link> . Should it be redirected to Github <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/raw/r0.10/tensorflow/examples/tutorials/monitors/iris_monitors.py>there</denchmark-link> ?

comments.comment: Looks like something got lost in translation between the internal and external code repositories.

Apologies for the error <denchmark-link:https://github.com/fansgit>@fansgit</denchmark-link> . The correct link is: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/code/tensorflow/examples/tutorials/monitors/iris_monitors.py>https://www.tensorflow.org/code/tensorflow/examples/tutorials/monitors/iris_monitors.py</denchmark-link>
I actually already fixed this on 8/19 in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/4a510c1779d8c904ea3e8bb7988e91762a9cf67c>4a510c1</denchmark-link> . It just needs to be folded into the r0.10 branch and published out to the website. I'll make a PR for that.
This seems to be all fixed now. Closing.
